aboutMe.text: I make games at Two Scoop Games
I help run an interactive art non-profit that provides free kids code education at Louisville Makes Games!
Available for contract work game & app projects at Two Scoop Interactive

work.title: Lead Visual Designer
work.name: Two Scoop Interactive
work.description: "Let's create something fun!" - Two Scoop Interactive is the client-facing part of my company Two Scoop Games. Under this name we create games, apps, and interactive experiences for our clients. What can we make for you or your business?

work.title: Creator/Designer/Artist
work.name: Two Scoop Games
work.description: Game development allows me combine my passion for art and technology to create games for all to enjoy. Since we met at a local programming meetup in Nov 2013, Eric Lathrop and I have been working on making our own games. We have currently completed 3 full releases on online app stores, and 14 game prototypes.

work.title: UX Engineer
work.name: Platform Q
work.description: At Platform Q I worked to translate wireframes, mockups, and prototypes into intuitive user experiences. I worked fully remote with a team of talented developers to implement designs and features for a highly profitable online video learning platform. I worked with two teams and maintained daily communication. Technologies included Wordpress, Angular 4, JavaScript, and CSS / SASS.

work.title: Web Developer
work.name: cafepress
work.description: I started at cafepress on a small labs team focused on creating new and exciting products and the web experiences to get those products in front of customers. After that I moved to the front end team on the main cafepress website, where I managed pages seen by tens of thousands of users a day. I primarily worked in JavaScript, HTML, and CSS.

work.title: Front End Web Developer
work.name: Mortenson Dental Partners
work.description: I designed and developed internal use web apps and internal/external websites. While I specialized in the design and UI/UX of each project, I also gained a lot of useful experience with C# and SQL. I was the UX watchdog on the team, and fought for the users in any way I could.

work.title: Independent Web Designer
work.name: AlexBezuska.com
work.description: I worked one-on-one with clients to bring their vision and purpose to life on each custom website. To do this I worked to balance the end user’s needs and the client’s requests.

community.title: Co-Founder/Director
community.name: Louisville Makes Games, Inc.
community.description: In 2015 I co-founded a 501-(c)(3) non-profit organization called Louisville Makes Games, Inc. The goal of LMG is to provide educational courses and promote game development careers in the city of Louisville, KY. In February 2016, we had the grand opening for Warp Zone Louisville, the first and only game development-centric co-working space in Lousiville (and Kentucky!). We run meetups, classes, and events out of Warp Zone as well as providing the ammenities of a co-working space on Main Street in downtown Louisville.

community.title: Co - Founder / Organizer / Host
community.name: Lousville Game Creator's Meetup
community.description: The independent game developer community in Louisville is a huge passion of mine. The Lousville Game Creator's Meetup (formerly Game Dev Lou) is a twice-monthly meetup and support group for local game developers. I have facilitated nearly every meeting, and to date I have helped to organize 3-4 game jam events per year.

community.title: Founder / Organizer / Host
community.name: JSLou - Louisville's JavaScript Community
community.description: In order to grow and challenge myself as a developer, I founded and hosted JSLou; a local group focused on all things JavaScript. I have learned a great deal from the many experienced developers I have met through JSLou. I enjoyed facilitating an environment where others can learn and expand their skills. After maintaining the group for nearly 5 years I passed the torch to new passionate developers to continue facilitating the community.

speaking.description: In 2018 at Vector game devlopers conference I did a talk about what I have learned from doing over 20 game prototypes. At Code PaLOUsa, a local developer conference, I had the privilege of running workshops on 3 seperate occasions (2015, 2016, and 2018) where I taught participants to create games using Unity, and HTML5/JavaScript. I have spoken several times at Game Development and JavaScript meetups about varous game and web development topics.
speaking.imgalt: Alex Bezuska and Eric Lathrop of Two Scoop Games speaking in Lexington at Run Jump Dev

teaching.description: In 2017 I had a major role in the development and teaching of a free 6-week summer program at Warp Zone Louisville to give kids a taste of the many disciplines of game development including; coding, story, art & animation, music & sound, and game design. In 2014 I taught a monthly game development workshop at Velocity Indiana for youth ages 11-18 as part of their code education program.
teaching.imgalt: Louisville Makes Games! a non profit game development career and education advocate group

advocating.description: In summer 2015 I helped to found the 501(c)(3) non-profit 'Louisville Makes Games, Inc.'. As a director of LMG, I strive to continue the momentum of Louisville's growing game development community and provide inclusive, encouraging, and beginner-friendly events. I founded and hosted Louisville's JavaScript Group JSLou with 2 regular meetings each month for almost 5 years.
